entities.name: PostgreSQL Node

effectors.name: executeScript
effectors.description: Executes the given script contents using psql

effectors.name: populateServiceNotUpDiagnostics
effectors.description: Populates the attribute service.notUp.diagnostics, with any available health indicators

effectors.name: restart
effectors.description: Restart the process/service represented by an entity

effectors.name: start

parameters.name: locations
parameters.description: The location or locations to start in, as a string, a location object, a list of strings, or a list of location objects

effectors.description: Start the process/service represented by an entity

effectors.name: stop
effectors.description: Stop the process/service represented by an entity

sensors.name: datastore.url
sensors.description: Primary contact URL for a datastore (e.g. mysql://localhost:3306/)

sensors.name: download.addon.urls
sensors.description: URL patterns for downloading named add-ons (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)

sensors.name: download.url
sensors.description: URL pattern for downloading the installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)

sensors.name: expandedinstall.dir
sensors.description: Directory for installed artifacts (e.g. expanded dir after unpacking .tgz)

sensors.name: host.address
sensors.description: Host IP address

sensors.name: host.name
sensors.description: Host name

sensors.name: host.subnet.address
sensors.description: Host address as known internally in the subnet where it is running (if different to host.name)

sensors.name: host.subnet.hostname
sensors.description: Host name as known internally in the subnet where it is running (if different to host.name)

sensors.name: install.dir
sensors.description: Directory for this software to be installed in

sensors.name: postgresql.database
sensors.description: Database to be used

sensors.name: postgresql.password
sensors.description: Password for the database user, auto-generated if not set

sensors.name: postgresql.port
sensors.description: PostgreSQL port

sensors.name: postgresql.username
sensors.description: Username of the database user

sensors.name: run.dir
sensors.description: Directory for this software to be run from

sensors.name: service.isUp
sensors.description: Whether the service is active and availability (confirmed and monitored)

sensors.name: service.process.isRunning
sensors.description: Whether the process for the service is confirmed as running

sensors.name: service.state
sensors.description: Actual lifecycle state of the service

sensors.name: service.state.expected
sensors.description: Last controlled change to service state, indicating what the expected state should be

sensors.name: softwareprocess.pid.file
sensors.description: PID file

sensors.name: softwareservice.provisioningLocation
sensors.description: Location used to provision a machine where this is running

config.name: archive.nameFormat
config.description: The format for the directory created when the installation archive is extracted, if required. The version string will be passed in as the first argument, replacing the %s format specifier

config.name: children.startable.mode
config.description: Controls behaviour when starting Startable children as part of this entity's lifecycle.

config.name: commands
config.description: commands

config.name: customize.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking customize until ready

config.name: datastore.creation.script.contents
config.description: Contents of creation script to initialize the datastore

config.name: datastore.creation.script.template.url
config.description: URL of creation script Freemarker template used to initialize the datastore (ignored if datastore.creation.script.contents or datastore.creation.script.url is specified)

config.name: datastore.creation.script.url
config.description: URL of creation script to use to initialize the datastore (ignored if creationScriptContents is specified)

config.name: dontRequireTtyForSudo
config.description: Whether to explicitly set /etc/sudoers, so don't need tty (will leave unchanged if 'false'); some machines require a tty for sudo; brooklyn by default does not use a tty (so that it can get separate error+stdout streams); you can enable a tty as an option to every ssh command, or you can do it once and modify the machine so that a tty is not subsequently required.

config.name: download.addon.urls
config.description: URL patterns for downloading named add-ons (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)

config.name: download.url
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)

config.name: entity.running
config.description: Skip the startup process entirely, if service already running

config.name: entity.started
config.description: Skip the startup process entirely, for running services

config.name: expandedinstall.dir
config.description: Directory for installed artifacts (e.g. expanded dir after unpacking .tgz)

config.name: files.install
config.description: Mapping of files, to be copied before install, to destination name relative to installDir

config.name: files.preinstall
config.description: Mapping of files, to be copied before install, to destination name relative to installDir

config.name: files.runtime
config.description: Mapping of files, to be copied before customisation, to destination name relative to runDir

config.name: inboundPorts.autoInfer
config.description: If set to false turns off the opening of ports based on naming convention, and also those that are of type PortRange in Java entities

config.name: inboundPorts.configRegex
config.description: Regex governing the opening of ports based on config names

config.name: install.dir
config.description: Directory for this software to be installed in

config.name: install.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking install until ready

config.name: install.skip
config.description: Skip the driver install commands entirely, for pre-installed software

config.name: install.unique_label
config.description: Provides a label which uniquely identifies an installation, used in the computation of the install dir; this should include something readable, and must include a hash of all data which differentiates an installation (e.g. version, plugins, etc), but should be the same where install dirs can be shared to allow for re-use

config.name: install.version
config.description: Suggested version

config.name: launch.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking launch until ready

config.name: metrics.usage.retrieve
config.description: Whether to retrieve the usage (e.g. performance) metrics

config.name: openIptables
config.description: Whether to open the INBOUND_PORTS via iptables rules; if true then ssh in to run iptables commands, as part of machine provisioning

config.name: post.customize.command
config.description: Command to be run after the customize method being called on the driver

config.name: post.install.command
config.description: Command to be run after the install method being called on the driver

config.name: post.launch.command
config.description: Command to be run after the launch method being called on the driver

config.name: postgresql.authConfig.file.url
config.description: URL where PostgreSQL host-based authentication configuration file can be found; if not supplied the blueprint uses the default and customises it

config.name: postgresql.config.file.url
config.description: URL where PostgreSQL configuration file can be found; if not supplied the blueprint uses the default and customises it

config.name: postgresql.database
config.description: Database to be used

config.name: postgresql.disconnect.on.stop
config.description: If true, PostgreSQL will immediately disconnet (pg_ctl -m immediate stop) all current connections when the node is stopped

config.name: postgresql.initialize
config.description: If true, PostgreSQL will create a new user and database

config.name: postgresql.maxConnections
config.description: Maximum number of connections to the database

config.name: postgresql.password
config.description: Password for the database user, auto-generated if not set

config.name: postgresql.port
config.description: PostgreSQL port

config.name: postgresql.sensorpoll
config.description: Poll period (in milliseconds)

config.name: postgresql.sharedMemory
config.description: Size of shared memory buffer (must specify as kB, MB or GB, minimum 128kB)

config.name: postgresql.username
config.description: Username of the database user

config.name: pre.customize.command
config.description: Command to be run prior to the customize method being called on the driver

config.name: pre.install.command
config.description: Command to be run prior to the install method being called on the driver

config.name: pre.launch.command
config.description: Command to be run prior to the launch method being called on the driver

config.name: provisioning.properties
config.description: Custom properties to be passed in when provisioning a new machine

config.name: requiredOpenLoginPorts
config.description: The port(s) to be opened, to allow login

config.name: resources.install.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking install resources until ready

config.name: resources.runtime.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking runtime resources until ready

config.name: run.dir
config.description: Directory for this software to be run from

config.name: setup.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking setup until ready

config.name: shell.env
config.description: Map of environment variables to pass to the runtime shell

config.name: softwareProcess.lifecycleTasks
config.description: An object that handles lifecycle of an entity's associated machine.

config.name: softwareProcess.maxSensorRebindDelay
config.description: The maximum delay to apply when reconnecting sensors when rebinding to this entity. Brooklyn will wait a random amount of time, up to the value of this config key, to avoid a thundering herd problem when the entity shares its machine with several others. Set to null or to 0 to disable any delay.

config.name: start.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking start until ready

config.name: start.timeout
config.description: Time to wait for process and for SERVICE_UP before failing (in seconds, default 2m)

config.name: stopIptables
config.description: Whether to stop iptables entirely; if true then ssh in to stop the iptables service, as part of machine provisioning

config.name: templates.install
config.description: Mapping of templates, to be filled in and copied before install, to destination name relative to installDir

config.name: templates.preinstall
config.description: Mapping of templates, to be filled in and copied before pre-install, to destination name relative to installDir

config.name: templates.runtime
config.description: Mapping of templates, to be filled in and copied before customisation, to destination name relative to runDir

entities.description: PostgreSQL is an object-relational database management system (ORDBMS)
